borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: Notwithstanding the provisions of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no development falling within CLASS XXX in Part 1 of Schedule 2 to that Order shall be carried out without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
Calibri">The dwelling hereby permitted shall comply with the requirements of
Building Regulation M4(2) 'accessible and adaptable dwellings'. Evidence of
compliance shall be notified to the building control body appointed for the development
in the appropriate Full Plans Application, or Building Notice, or Initial
Notice to enable the building control body to check compliance.</span></p>
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

<p class="MsoNormal">No development shall commence until:<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">(a) a<span lang="EN-US">n
investigation and risk assessment, in addition to any assessment provided with
the planning application, has been completed in accordance with a scheme to
assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site, whether or not
it originates on the site.&nbsp; The contents of the scheme are subject to the
approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The investigation
and risk assessment must be undertaken by competent persons and a written
report of the findings must be produced.&nbsp; The written report is subject to
the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The report of
the findings must include:<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span lang="EN-US">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:35.45pt;text-indent:-14.15pt;text-autospace:
none">(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; a survey of the extent, scale and nature of
contamination;<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:42.55pt;text-indent:-21.25pt;text-autospace:
none">(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; an assessment of the potential risks to human
health; property (existing or proposed) including buildings, crops, livestock,
pets, woodland and service lines and pipes; adjoining land; groundwaters and
surface waters; ecological systems; archaeological sites and ancient monuments;
and<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:35.45pt;text-indent:-14.15pt;text-autospace:
none">(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp; an appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the
preferred option(s). <o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:35.45pt;text-indent:-14.15pt;text-autospace:
none"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">This must be conducted in
accordance with DEFRA and the Environment Agency’s ‘Model Procedures for the
Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11’; and<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">(b)&nbsp;&nbsp; a detailed
remediation scheme, to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended
use by removing unacceptable risks to human health, buildings and other
property and the natural and historical environment, has been prepared and
submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing.&nbsp; The
scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives
and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management
procedures.&nbsp; The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as
contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in
relation to the intended use of the land after remediation. <o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">(c)&nbsp; The approved
remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to
commencement of the development, other than that required to carry out
remediation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning
Authority.&nbsp; The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written
notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">Following completion of measures
identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that
demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced
and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The report shall include results of
sampling and monitoring carried out to demonstrate that the site remediation
criteria have been met.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right:19.3pt;text-autospace:none">(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;
In the event that contamination is found at any time when carrying out the
approved development that was not previously identified it must be reported in
writing immediately to the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; An investigation and
risk assessment must be undertaken in accordance with the requirements of (a),
and where remediation is necessary a remediation scheme must be prepared in
accordance with the requirements of (b), which is subject to the approval in
writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; Following completion of measures
identified in the approved remediation scheme a verification report must be
prepared, which is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning
Authority.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right:19.3pt;text-autospace:none"><br></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">Demolition,
construction and associated activities, other than internal works not audible
at the site boundary, shall not take place on the site other than between the
hours of 0800 to 1800 on Monday to Friday and 0800 to 1300 on Saturday and not
at all on Sundays, Public or Bank Holidays and any works which are associated
with the generation of ground borne vibration are only to be carried out
between the hours of 0800 and 1800 Monday to Friday, unless otherwise agreed in
writing by the Local Planning Authority <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>

</p><p class="MsoNormal"><br></p>

The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:

- DRAWING XXX REV XX DATED XX
- USE [SHIFT]+[ENTER] FOR REGULAR LINE SPACING
- USE [ENTER] FOR LARGER LINE SPACING

No other drawings or documents apply.

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
Calibri">Prior to occupation of the development, a scheme showing details of
hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatment for the site, including
details of materials, species and a planting schedule, shall be submitted to
and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The approved hard landscaping and boundary
treatment shall be carried out prior to the occupation of the development and
thereafter permanently retained.&nbsp; The
approved soft landscaping shall be carried out in the first planting and seeding
seasons following the occupation of the building or completion of the
development, whichever is the sooner.&nbsp;
Any plants which within a period of 5 years from the completion of the
development die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be
replaced in the next planting season with others of similar size and species
unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.</span><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p>

</p><p class="MsoNormal"><br></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
Calibri">Any use of the dwelling hereby permitted for purposes other than those
of paragraph (a) of Class C3 of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes)
Order 1987 (as amended) is subject to approval in writing by the Local Planning
Authority.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">No development above ground level shall take place until details of refuse enclosures showing the design; location and external appearance have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved enclosures shall be provided before the commencement of the use and thereafter permanently retained.</span></p>
description: Construction of a new two storey 2x bedroom dwellinghouse next to existing dwellinghouse.
